Articles.Content:
It's the end of the term at my school! I can finally go home and enjoy myself on the holidays! Except, my laptop is being collected by the IT department to be upgraded to Windows 10. This means that I won't be able to use it over the two week holiday period, and thus won't be on the forums. So, goodbye for now, and see you in two weeks...

And also, goodbye Cassini.

I will say this: I'm an idiot. I forgot that I could use my iPad to visit the forums, but I just logged on again from it. For the whole two weeks, I hadn't thought of using this to visit the site, but here I am, from a two week break of Xbox and the occasional model kit.

On 9/14/2017 at 6:39 PM, The_Cat_In_Space said:

It's the end of the term at my school! I can finally go home and enjoy myself on the holidays! Except, my laptop is being collected by the IT department to be upgraded to Windows 10. This means that I won't be able to use it over the two week holiday period, and thus won't be on the forums. So, goodbye for now, and see you in two weeks...

And also, goodbye Cassini.

 

Wait, why does your school term end in September? Mine begins in September.

On 1 October 2017 at 5:41 AM, qzgy said:

Wait, why does your school term end in September? Mine begins in September.

I'm in Australia. I go back to school tomorrow,.but it's only an eight week term. I finish around November 25th, and then it's a two month holiday break. Tomorrow I'll re-install KSP on my computer, now with Windows 10. Hopefully the IT department haven't reconfigured our computers to block 'external programs', or else I won't be playing KSP anymore.

Just now, The_Cat_In_Space said:

I'm in Australia. I go back to school tomorrow,.but it's only an eight week term. I finish around November 25th, and then it's a two month holiday break. Tomorrow I'll re-install KSP on my computer, now with Windows 10. Hopefully the IT department haven't reconfigured our computers to block 'external programs', or else I won't be playing KSP anymore. 

Ohhh. I live in the US, so I guess its a reverse seasonal thing (This I guess was spring break, which usually for me is in March/April).

Hopefully you can play KSP again. Its only kinda addictive.

Just now, qzgy said:

Ohhh. I live in the US, so I guess its a reverse seasonal thing (This I guess was spring break, which usually for me is in March/April).

Hopefully you can play KSP again. Its only kinda addictive.

*very addictive, you mean
